titles.title: Wheeling National Heritage Area Act of 1993
Wheeling National Heritage Area Act of 1994
To establish the Wheeling National Heritage Area in the State of West Virginia, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests and Public Lands.

committee.name: House Committee on Natural Resources
committee.subcommittee: National Parks, Forests and Public Lands

committee.name: House Committee on Natural Resources
committee.subcommittee: National Parks, Forests and Public Lands

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Natural Resources
committee.subcommittee: National Parks, Forests and Public Lands

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended) by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Natural Resources. H. Rept. 103-471.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 263.

action.text: Mr. Vento moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 5, rule I, the chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed until April 13.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Failed by the Yeas and Nays (2/3 required): 264 - 154 (Roll No. 101).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.name: House Natural Resources
committee.subcommittee: National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands

bill.summary: 4/12/1994--Reported to House amended. Wheeling National Heritage Area Act of 1994 - Establishes the Wheeling National Heritage Area in West Virginia. Directs the Secretary of the Interior to: (1) assist appropriate local entities in the development of interpretive and educational materials as specified in the August 1992 Plan for the Wheeling National Heritage Area; (2) provide funds for capital improvements to projects and initial operating assistance; and (3) provide technical assistance to the local entities in the preparation of plans or studies pursuant to the Plan. Authorizes appropriations. Limits funds made available for capital projects and planning and studies to 50 percent of the costs of the project funded.
